source_sentence: 佛說福力太子因緣經卷第二
translation: Foshuo foulli 太子因緣經卷第二佛說福力太子因緣經經經,卷第二

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝奉大夫試光祿卿

source_sentence: 傳法大師賜紫沙門臣施護等奉　詔譯「復次，福力太子，乃至後時，與彼四兄出遊園苑；
translation: “Furthermore, Prince Fuli and his four brothers went out to the pleasure grove.

source_sentence: 而於中路，有無數千針口餓鬼，居山半腹，容貌羸瘦，其猶聚骨，遍身熾焰，
translation: On the way, however, there were countless thousands of needle-mouthed hungry ghosts living halfway up the mountain. Their appearance was slender and thin, like a mass of bones all over their bodies blazing with flames.

source_sentence: 鬼眾圍繞人所不見，唯福力太子先覩其狀。
translation: The demons surrounded the prince and they did not see him, except Prince Fuli, who saw his form beforehand.

source_sentence: 而彼餓鬼，合掌居前，白太子言：『汝大福德，有大名稱，是悲愍者。
translation: The hungry ghost then joined his palms and stood in front of him. He said to the crown prince, “Your great meritorious virtue and renowned reputation are due to compassion.

source_sentence: 我等飢渴，苦惱所逼，願今餉我，少分飲食。
translation: World-Honored One, we are hungry and thirsty, tormented by pain and suffering. We entreat you to provide us with food and drink for a little while now.

source_sentence: 我等宿世，造慳悋因，故此生中，墮餓鬼界，無數千歲，不得水飲，況復於食而可見邪？』
translation: In our past lives, we created the causes of stinginess and greed; therefore, when we were born here, we fell into the realm of hungry ghosts for countless thousands of years and didn't get water to drink, so why would we see

source_sentence: 時福力太子，仰瞻虛空，即起悲念：『快哉！
translation: The prince of the power of blessedness then looked up into space and raised his compassionate thoughts, 'How wonderful!'

source_sentence: 我今若得天降少分飲食，當用餉此諸餓鬼眾。』
translation: Now, if I were to receive a small portion of food and drink from the gods, I would feed these hungry ghosts.'

source_sentence: 是時忽然有多飲食，自天而降。
translation: Suddenly, a large amount of food and drink suddenly descended down from the sky.

source_sentence: 福力太子，即以此食，餉諸餓鬼。
translation: Prince Pūrṇa福力 then fed the hungry ghosts with this food.

source_sentence: 彼餓鬼眾，宿業力故，悉不能見，咸作是言：『太子！
translation: Because of the power of their past actions, those hungry ghosts were unable to see them. They all said:

source_sentence: 我昔聞汝是悲愍者，何故今時不以飲食餉於我等？』
translation: When I heard that you were compassionate, why didn't you feed us with food and drink at the present time?'

source_sentence: 太子告言：『我以天降飲食，前授汝等，云何于今不取食邪？』
translation: The prince told them, 'I gave you food and drink from heaven and gave it to you in front of me, so why wouldn't I take the food now?'

source_sentence: 餓鬼白言：『太子！
translation: The hungry ghosts said, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 我等宿業力故，悉不能見。』
translation: Because of the power of our past actions, we can't see them.'

source_sentence: 時福力太子，復起是念：『愍哉！
translation: The prince of the power of merit then again had this thought, 'What a pity!

source_sentence: 慳悋是不可愛。』
translation: Being stingy is not desirable.'

source_sentence: 乃作是言：『若諸福報有大力能，以我如是真實語故，令此餓鬼得見飲食，
translation: He said, “If the rewards of merit have such great powers, then by means of my true words I will enable these hungry ghosts to eat and drink.

source_sentence: 一切隨應皆能取食。』
translation: They'll be able to take food at any time.'

source_sentence: 發是言已，彼諸餓鬼，悉能見食，即時各變，面相如人。
translation: Having said these words, the hungry ghosts were all able to see their food. Immediately each of them changed his or her features and looked human.

source_sentence: 福力太子，心生歡喜，遂以飲食，恣其所取。
translation: The prince of the power of blessedness was overjoyed, so he gave food and drink as freely as he wished.

source_sentence: 彼餓鬼眾，既得食已，頓止飢渴，身力完具，壯實充盛，無醜惡形，乃於福力太子，
translation: When the hungry ghosts had eaten, they suddenly stopped hunger and thirst. Endowed with physical strength, they were strong and vigorous, without ugly or unwholesome features.

source_sentence: 各起清淨歡喜之意；
translation: Each gave rise to pure joyous aspiration.

source_sentence: 即時命終，皆得生於兜率天上，旋處空中，白太子言：『太子！
translation: Immediately after their deaths, they'll all be born in the Tuṣita Heaven, circle up into the sky, and say to the prince, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 我等得生兜率天上，皆由汝之威神建立。』
translation: We'll be born in the Tuṣita Heaven, all established by your authoritative power.'

source_sentence: 「福力太子，聞此妙善語已，深大慶悅，即時前進詣園林中，與彼諸兄，
translation: Having heard these sublime words of goodness, Prince Pūrṇa Mantāṇiputta was greatly delighted. Hearing them, he immediately advanced to the grove and gave them to his brothers.

source_sentence: 共會議言：『世間人眾，何所修作，多獲義利？』
translation: They all gathered together and said, 'What's cultivated by the people of the world that obtains so much benefit?'

source_sentence: 彼色相具足者言：『今此世間色相行業，若人修作，多獲義利。
translation: Those who are endowed with form and characteristics say, 'Nowadays, in this world, form and characteristic activity are cultivated, and if people cultivate them, they'll often attain meaningful benefits.

source_sentence: 何故知邪？
translation: Why do they know what's wrong?

source_sentence: 謂若有人，他昔未見，見即歡喜；
translation: Suppose there is a person who, seeing something he had never seen before, immediately rejoices at the sight.

source_sentence: 昔未信重，見已信重。
translation: Formerly I did not believe in Buddhism but now that I have seen it, I believe in Buddhism.

source_sentence: 如我往昔，師尊仙人，亦作是說，若有具足妙色相者，為人所喜，妙色可觀，
translation: As I said in the past, “If one is endowed with marvelous forms and characteristics, he will be delighted by people. Marvelous forms are to be seen.

source_sentence: 瞻奉愛樂；
translation: They look out for joy and reverence, and take pleasure in it.

source_sentence: 猶如智人，樂最上法，設諸供養。』
translation: It's like a wise person who delights in the supreme Dharma and sets up offerings.'

source_sentence: 「復次，精進具足者言：『非修色相多獲義利！
translation: Furthermore, those who are fully endowed with effort say, 'If they don't cultivate form and characteristics, they'll often attain their meaning!'

source_sentence: 今此應知，精進行業，若人修作，多獲義利。
translation: This should now be known as the activity of zealous effort. If one cultivates it, much benefit will be gained.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 雖修色相，而無精進，豈能現世及他世中，獲可意果？
translation: Even though they cultivate form and characteristics, how can they attain agreeable results in the present life or in other lives without effort?

source_sentence: 或謂色相多獲義利者，彼是愚人，癡見所覆。
translation: Or it may be said that form and characteristics often obtain meaningful benefits, but this is a foolish man who's covered by deluded views.

source_sentence: 如我所說，精進行業，於現世中能成可意果者，謂猶農夫植種，商賈獲利，
translation: As I have said, the karma that is energetic and generates energy produces agreeable results in the present life. That is to say, it is like a farmer planting seeds for the benefit of merchants and traders.

source_sentence: 仕者受祿，學人通教，修習禪定，得輕安果，皆為現世精進所成諸可意果。
translation: Those who serve receive their salaries, and those who study the teachings generally cultivate meditation and attain the result of lightness and peace are all desirable results achieved by effort in the present life.

source_sentence: 又此精進，於他世中能成可意果者，謂生善趣及生天界，大富自在，現證解脫，
translation: “Furthermore, this zeal can produce agreeable results in other worlds”: Those who are born in a good realm of existence and those born in heavenly realms have great richness and self-dependence. They manifest liberation.

source_sentence: 皆為他世精進所成諸可意果。
translation: They're all the desirable results that are formed by other worldly effort.

source_sentence: 由此一切功德，皆以精進而為依止。
translation: As a result, all merits are based on effort as their support.

source_sentence: 又此精進，能治怯弱，若運精進，無有少法而難成者。』
translation: Furthermore, this effort can counteract weaknesses, and if you make effort, there won't be few things that are difficult to accomplish.'

source_sentence: 「復次，工巧具足者言：『汝諸仁者，雖復多種所說，而實不能稱可我心。
translation: Furthermore, those who are skilled in the arts and crafts say, 'Friends, even though you have explained so much, you really can't call it a self-worthy mind.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 所有精進，若無工巧，而終不能現有所成；
translation: All the effort they make, even without skill in craftsmanship, cannot produce anything to be done.

source_sentence: 若復精進同工巧作，乃能如實所作現成。
translation: If they also make effort in the same way as skillful artisans, then they'll be able to actualize what they've done.

source_sentence: 是故應知，工巧行業，若人修作，多獲義利。
translation: Therefore, you should know that the activities of craftsmanship and skillfulness are often for profit if someone cultivates them.

source_sentence: 又復具工巧者，若王、若臣，若沙門、婆羅門，諸長者等，乃至下族中人，
translation: Furthermore, if someone is endowed with skillful means, such as kings, ministers, śramaṇas, brāhmaṇas, wealthy householders, and so forth, up to the people of lower castes and middle classes,

source_sentence: 及諸工巧之者，悉來供獻。』
translation: And those who are skilled in the arts and crafts, they'll all come to make offerings.'

source_sentence: 「復次，智慧具足者言：『汝等當知，人所修作，多獲義利者，且非色相，
translation: “Furthermore, those who are endowed with wisdom say, ‘You should know that what people cultivate often brings benefit, even if it is not form or shape.

source_sentence: 亦非精進，又非工巧。
translation: Nor is it effort, and nor is it skillful.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 所觀色相，若無智慧，雖復相似而不淨妙。
translation: If the form and characteristics that are observed lack wisdom, then even though they are similar, they aren't pure and marvelous.

source_sentence: 所起精進，若無智慧，雖得義利而無有成。
translation: If there's no wisdom, then even though they attain meaning and benefit, there's no accomplishment of the effort that arises.

source_sentence: 所作工巧，若無智慧，雖復營修不能攝持。
translation: If there's no wisdom, then even though they cultivate it, they can't maintain it.

source_sentence: 是故應知，智慧能成一切事業，若人修作，多獲義利。
translation: Therefore, you should know that wisdom can accomplish all works, and if someone cultivates it, they'll often attain their goal.

source_sentence: 又此智慧，能得色相，能成工巧，能發精進，能獲人中一切妙樂。』
translation: Furthermore, this wisdom can attain form and characteristics, become skillful in craftsmanship, give rise to effort, and obtain all the marvelous pleasures of humans.'

source_sentence: 「爾時福力太子，熙怡瞻視具智慧者，而謂之言：『如是，如是！
translation: At the time, Prince Fuli, who was joyfully gazing at someone endowed with wisdom, said to him, 'So it is, so it is!'

source_sentence: 汝言真實。
translation: You say it's real.

source_sentence: 所有色相、工巧、精進，若無智慧，不能多獲義利。
translation: All the forms, characteristics, skills, and exertions there are, but if they don't have wisdom, they won't attain much benefit.

source_sentence: 故知智慧普能攝持諸如實果。
translation: Therefore, it's known that wisdom universally collects and maintains the true results.

source_sentence: 仁者！
translation: My dear friend!

source_sentence: 然此智慧若無福力，諸有所作，亦不得成。
translation: However, if this wisdom doesn't have the power of merit, nothing will be done, and nothing will be accomplished.

source_sentence: 是故實知，若人修福，多獲義利。
translation: Therefore, it's really known that if someone cultivates goodness, they'll often attain meaningful benefits.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 福是純一果，福為光澤果，福為可意果，福是適悅果。
translation: Merit is a pure and singular fruit. Merit is a shining fruit. Virtue is an agreeable fruit. Merit is a pleasant fruit.

source_sentence: 如是福果，我不能盡說其功德，今為汝等，使開覺故，於福門中，說一少分，
translation: I cannot explain in detail all the merits of these fruits of virtuous deeds. Now, to enable you to awaken your minds, I will teach one part of the doctrine of meritorious deeds:

source_sentence: 汝等善聽。
translation: All of you, listen well.

source_sentence: 由有福故，能獲色相，福具精進，福得吉祥亦獲大富，福具智慧，福能歌詠正法功德，
translation: Because of having merit, they are able to attain form and characteristics. Their accumulation of merit is accompanied by diligence. Having acquired good fortune, the auspicious one also attains great wealth. The accumulation of merit is

source_sentence: 福具聰利，福遊正道，福生上族，福得宿念，福具名稱，福圓戒行，福能布施，
translation: Their virtue is endowed with intelligence, their virtue travels the right path, their virtue produces superior clans, their virtue acquires past thoughts, their virtue has a name, their virtue perfects morality and conduct, their virtu

source_sentence: 福力常得諸根不壞，福常快樂，有福常受智者所供，福完諸力，福常會遇善友知識，
translation: The power of virtue always attains the faculties that don’t break down, is always happy with virtue, always receives what’s offered by wise people who have virtue, perfects all his powers with virtue, and always meets

source_sentence: 福力能作一切事業——謂若耕植田里，或復商賈求利少施其功大獲積集，
translation: The power of virtue can perform all kinds of works-that is, if one plows a field or cultivates it, or if another merchant seeks profit and gives little to others, the merit will be greatly accumulated.

source_sentence: 富盛自在。
translation: Their wealth is abundant and unimpeded.

source_sentence: 有福即能於思念間，虛空自然雨其衣服飲食珍寶，一切具足，隨受快樂。
translation: If someone has merit, they'll be able to instantly rain down their clothing, food, and treasures from space in the midst of thoughts, all fully endowed with happiness as they experience it.

source_sentence: 福獲可意妙好舍宅；
translation: By blessedness they obtained pleasant and beautiful houses.

source_sentence: 福於現世，及於他生，常得姝麗、妻女、眷屬及財穀等。
translation: In the present life and in other lives, they'll always attain beauty, wives, retinues, possessions, grains, and so forth.

source_sentence: 福者所行之地，自然無其荊棘沙礫，住立平穩；
translation: The land where the blessed one walks naturally has no thorns, thorny rocks, or debris. He stands erect and stable.

source_sentence: 福者亦獲廣大身相；
translation: The blessed one also acquires a vast bodily mark.

source_sentence: 若有患人，福者手所觸時，病隨輕差；
translation: Suppose there is an ailing person who, when touched by the hand of a blessed one, his illness gradually improves.

source_sentence: 又復福者隨觸於人，即能出彼飲食、衣服、珍寶、財穀，給用無盡；
translation: Furthermore, a blessed one can give food and drink, clothing, rare treasures, riches, and grains to anyone he touches, providing them with endless supplies.

source_sentence: 福者常得天龍夜叉羅剎鬼等隨處衛護，其猶雨時護苗稼神守護亦然。
translation: A blessed person always receives protection from gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, ghosts, and so forth, just as a crop-protecting spirit protects the crops when it rains.

source_sentence: 福者常得多人尊重愛樂；
translation: A blessed one always receives the respect and affection of many people.

source_sentence: 福有善譽，福為人讚。
translation: Merit has a good reputation, and merit is praised by people.

source_sentence: 福常能具諸善法分；
translation: Merit always endowed with the characteristic of being able to embody wholesome states.

source_sentence: 福者語言人所信順；
translation: The blessed one speaks what people believe in.

source_sentence: 福者常得光澤可愛；
translation: The blessed one always obtains a shining luster and delightful appearance.

source_sentence: 福者常出微妙梵音；
translation: The blessed one always produces the subtle sound of Brahma.

source_sentence: 福者身胑自然柔軟；
translation: The blessed one’s body is coarse and naturally soft.

source_sentence: 福者常發妙善語言；
translation: The blessed one always produces subtle, good speech.

source_sentence: 福者常值良友智人不壞眷屬；
translation: The blessed one always meets a good friend and wise person, who does not break up his retinue.

source_sentence: 福者無病；
translation: The blessed one has no sickness.

source_sentence: 福者為人所愛；
translation: The blessed one is beloved by people.

source_sentence: 福獲財利；
translation: By virtue they attain wealth and benefit.

source_sentence: 福者勇猛。
translation: The virtuous one is courageous.

source_sentence: 又大福者，得為人王，無不具足，離諸疾病；
translation: Also, great blessedness is the attainment of becoming a human king, fully endowed with all good qualities and free from sickness.

source_sentence: 福者常得富盛不壞；
translation: The blessed always attain prosperity and are not destroyed.

source_sentence: 福者獲得轉輪伏藏，七寶具足；
translation: The blessed one attained the store of transfiguration and subjugation, fully endowed with the seven treasures.

source_sentence: 福者能於虛空中行；
translation: A blessed one can go up into the sky.

source_sentence: 福者威光與日月等；
translation: The authoritative light of the Buddha’s blessedness is the same as that of the sun and moon.

source_sentence: 福者得成月天；
translation: A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume II The blessed one attains the heaven of the moon.

source_sentence: 福者得成日天；
translation: A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume II The blessed one will become a sun god.

source_sentence: 福者得成梵王；
translation: The blessed one will become the king of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 福者得成帝釋；
translation: The blessed one attains the state of Śakra.

source_sentence: 福者能於天宮樓閣中行，如彼天子；
translation: A blessed one can walk in the tower of a celestial palace like that heavenly child.

source_sentence: 福者有大力勢，如阿修羅王；
translation: The blessed one has great power and momentum, like the asura king.

source_sentence: 福者常生善趣；
translation: A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume II The blessed one always gives rise to a good destiny.

source_sentence: 福者捨離惡趣；
translation: A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume II The blessed one has abandoned bad destinies.

source_sentence: 福者常獲最極難得悅意妙華；
translation: The blessed one always obtains the most extraordinary and difficult-to-obtain pleasant, subtle flower of joy.

source_sentence: 福者所作成就；
translation: It is accomplished by those of virtue.

source_sentence: 福者能為世間作諸照明；
translation: A blessed one is able to produce illumination for the world.

source_sentence: 福者常得天、人、阿修羅等正信供養。』
translation: Those who are blessed will always attain the right faith offerings of gods, humans, asuras, and so forth.'

source_sentence: 「太子說是諸福事時，四兄異見，修作不同，於是太子，又復言曰：『我今欲與諸兄潛適他國，
translation: When the prince said these meritorious deeds, the four brothers had different views and cultivated different practices. Then the prince again said, “I wish to go with my brothers to another kingdom.”

source_sentence: 隨所住處，證驗其事。
translation: Wherever they lived, they witnessed their deeds.

source_sentence: 為當色相人多修邪？
translation: Why should people with form and characteristics often cultivate error?

source_sentence: 或復精進、工巧、智慧福力人多修邪？』
translation: Or is it the case that many people of diligence, skillfulness, and wisdom cultivate error?'

source_sentence: 是時四兄，聞其言已，悉隨所行，不復告白父王，即適他國。
translation: When the four brothers heard these words, they all followed them, didn't confess to their father or king, and went to another country.

source_sentence: 「入一國已，易其裝飾，各求棲止。
translation: “After entering one country, they change their decorations and each seek to live in it.

source_sentence: 時色相具足者，以妙色故，人所瞻覩，皆生悅意，隨獲富盛，受用資養。
translation: When the form and characteristics are complete, it's because of their marvelous form that people who look at them all become delighted, gain wealth as they see fit, and receive support.

source_sentence: 精進具足者，以勇力故，能有所取；
translation: “Endowed with energy”: Because of the power of courage, they are able to grasp something.

source_sentence: 而忽見一迅流大河，深廣可怖，中有極大旃檀香樹，彼精進者，取得其樹，
translation: Suddenly he saw a large river running fast, deep and wide and fearful, with an extremely large sandalwood tree in it. The diligent one obtained that tree.

source_sentence: 貨易獲利，而成富盛，受用資養。
translation: It's easy to obtain goods, become wealthy, and receive the necessities of accumulation.

source_sentence: 工巧具足者，以工巧力，隨作諸事，由獲富盛，受用資養。
translation: A person who is endowed with skillful means that by using the power of skillful means, he performs various tasks to attain prosperity and receive provisions for it.

source_sentence: 智慧具足者，以巧智故，能解勝怨，復能親附有財力者，悅可其意令生歡喜，
translation: Those endowed with knowledge and wisdom are able, by means of skillful knowledge, to overcome enemies. They are also able to associate with those who have great wealth and powers, to delight in their thoughts and make them rejoice.

source_sentence: 隨獲衣飾及財寶等，如所快樂，受用資養。
translation: He receives the necessities of clothing, ornaments, possessions, and so forth as he wishes.

source_sentence: 「爾時福力太子，隨自勝福大威德力，周行施作利益福事。
translation: At the time, the prince of the power of merit, following his own superior fortune and great authoritative power, performed meritorious actions that benefited him.

source_sentence: 一日忽過貧人之舍，乃入其中，以彼太子福威力故，是舍忽有廣大吉祥勝相出現，
translation: One day he suddenly passed by a poor man’s dwelling and entered it. Because of the prince’s blessedness and mighty power, this dwelling suddenly had a large and auspicious sign that appeared.

source_sentence: 金寶財穀，周匝充盈。
translation: The monastery was surrounded by treasuries of gold, precious treasures, and grain.

source_sentence: 時彼貧人，見已驚怪歡喜，思念：『此如是事，昔所未有，由何所起？
translation: Seeing this, the poor man was startled and rejoicing. He thought to himself: Such a thing as this has never happened in the past! Where did it happen?

source_sentence: 從何所來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 豈非此人來我舍中，是其威力之所致邪？』
translation: Is isn't this person coming to my house because of the error caused by their authoritative power?'

source_sentence: 又念：『我昔極受貧苦，今獲勝利，一切豐盈，必由是人來此所致，使我舍中吉祥相現。
translation: They also thought, ‘In the past I suffered greatly from poverty and hardship. Now I am fortunate to have gained prosperity and all my possessions are abundant. It must be because of this person’s arrival here that an auspicious sign

source_sentence: 此人大福，有大名稱，宜應於彼尊重供養。』
translation: This great man of great merit has a great reputation, so it's appropriate to honor and make offerings to him.'

source_sentence: 由是尊奉，相續無間。
translation: Because of this veneration, it continues uninterruptedly.

source_sentence: 太子於其貧人舍中，致諸富盛，令快樂已，乃至後時，遍流聲譽：『某甲舍中，
translation: The prince stayed in that poor man’s dwelling, bringing prosperity to the rich and wealthy. Having made them happy, he spread his fame far and wide, saying:

source_sentence: 昔甚貧匱，有一異人，來入其舍，彼威力故，是舍忽然吉祥相現。』
translation: In the past, there was a very poor man who came into his dwelling and because of his authority, this dwelling suddenly appeared as an auspicious sign.'

source_sentence: 諸人聞已，於福力太子咸生信重，俱共讚言：『奇哉！
translation: When the people heard this, they all became convinced of the prince's miraculous power and praised him, saying, 'How marvelous!

source_sentence: 勝福，有大力能。』
translation: Being superior to merit, there's great power and ability.'

source_sentence: 又以太子福威力故，於彼方處，華樹果樹，開敷結實，時令不愆，遍灑甘雨，
translation: Also, because of the prince’s blessedness and mighty power, there were flowering trees and fruit-bearing trees in those places that grew fruit and caused no crops to grow. Everywhere they showered sweet rain.

source_sentence: 種子生成，而得滋茂。
translation: When seeds are planted, they grow and flourish.

source_sentence: 時諸人眾，於福力太子，深生愛樂，俱來瞻仰。
translation: The people then had deep affection for the prince of blessedness, and they all came to venerate him.

source_sentence: 「是時太子，為諸來者普攝其心，故作是念：『快哉！
translation: The prince then had this thought for the sake of the people who came to gather their minds, saying, 'That's wonderful!'

source_sentence: 今時我此舍中，可能獲得一切珍寶，種種樂具，及諸妙巧悅意等物，給所來者使令具足。』
translation: At the present time, in this house of mine, I'll be able to obtain all the treasures, various pleasures, and other wonderfully skillful and pleasing things that will enable those who come to me to make them complete.'

source_sentence: 發是心時，應念即現諸珍寶等，皆悉豐盈。
translation: When he arouses this intention, he should be mindful that all the treasures and treasures are present, and they're all abundant.

source_sentence: 時諸人眾，驚異歎言：『奇哉！
translation: The crowd of people then marveled and praised him, saying, 'How wonderful!'

source_sentence: 大福，為甘美果。』
translation: It's a great blessing, which is the sweet fruit.'

source_sentence: 乃於太子咸生尊重。
translation: They then all became respectful to the prince.

source_sentence: 是時太子，即為諸人，如其所應，以四攝法，平等攝持，悉令和合，所謂同一布施、愛語、利行、同事。
translation: The prince then, for the sake of all people, as they should be, uses the four methods of gathering in sentient beings to equally embrace and keep them together, which are called the same generosity, loving words, beneficial actions,

source_sentence: 由是名稱普聞一切國邑聚落。
translation: Because of this name, it's universally heard in all the cities and villages.

source_sentence: 「乃至後時，太子漸次到一國中，見其國王治罰一人善醫業者，勅彼獄官，
translation: “Soon after that, the prince gradually arrived in one kingdom and found that the king of that kingdom was punishing a good doctor who had been imprisoned.

source_sentence: 破其身胑，斷截手足。
translation: He broke his body and cut off his limbs, cutting off his hands and feet.

source_sentence: 流血既多，楚毒苦惱，是時被治罰人見太子已，發大苦聲，啼泣告言：『仁者！
translation: Since the blood flowed so heavily, it was so painful and distressing that the people punished at the time saw the prince. Seeing him, they cried in great pain and wept, saying:

source_sentence: 救我。
translation: He saves me.

source_sentence: 仁者！
translation: My dear friend!

source_sentence: 救我。』
translation: Please save me.'

source_sentence: 太子即時惻愴斯事，乃自思惟：『我今作何方便救此人苦？』
translation: Immediately embarrassed by this, the prince thought to himself, 'What method can I use now to save this person from suffering?'

source_sentence: 由是念間，忽生智解，如我所有施作福力世間現見。
translation: In that moment of thought, a wisdom and understanding suddenly arose, just as I had shown in the world by bestowing merit.

source_sentence: 作是念已，悲心內激，即破自身，多出其血，授彼令飲，苦惱得除。
translation: After he had this thought, his compassionate mind became agitated internally, and he broke into his own body, drew a lot of blood, gave it to them to drink, and was freed from their suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 太子又見手足已斷甚大苦惱，即取利刀斷己手足，置於彼人手足斷處。
translation: Seeing that his hands and feet had been cut off, the prince again became greatly distressed and took a sharp knife to cut off his hands and feet and placed them in the place where those people’s hands and feet were cut off.

source_sentence: 是時太子觀察虛空，普於一切有情隨起慈心，即發廣大真實願言：『我於此生，
translation: Then the prince, observing space and extending compassion to all sentient beings, made this great vow:

source_sentence: 曾無少分不善之業，若我所說為真實者，願令此人手足斷處，即於今時支節相合，
translation: If what I teach is true, may this man’s hands and feet be severed! At that very moment the limbs are joined.

source_sentence: 平復如故。』
translation: It's just as it was.'

source_sentence: 發是言已，彼人即時支節相合，身體完具，平復如故。
translation: After he spoke these words, that man's limbs immediately joined together, and his body was perfectly proportioned, just as before.

source_sentence: 太子見已，意願圓滿，即作是念：『我以勤勇，所作得成，出自身血，
translation: Seeing this, the prince’s wishes were fulfilled. Then he thought: Through my heroic efforts I accomplished what I had to do and drew blood out of my own bodies.

source_sentence: 救此人苦。
translation: I'll save this person from suffering.

source_sentence: 斷自手足，續其支節。
translation: He cuts off his own hands and feet and continues to extend their limbs.

source_sentence: 又以真實大誓願力，使彼身命全復如故。
translation: Also, by the power of their true great vow, they cause their bodies and lives to be completely restored as before.

source_sentence: 願我以此最上善根，成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果，當以法味授於彼人，
translation: “With these supreme roots of goodness, may I attain the fruit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment and bestow on them the flavor of truth.

source_sentence: 畢竟令住安樂涅槃。』
translation: After all, he causes them to abide in peaceful nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 發是願時，一切大地六種震動，帝釋天宮亦復震警。
translation: When he makes this vow, all the earth shakes in six ways, and Indra's heavenly palace also shakes and alerts.

source_sentence: 「爾時帝釋天主，即自思惟：『此何事相？』
translation: It was then that Indra, the lord of the gods, thought to himself, 'What's the mark of this?'

source_sentence: 而復觀察，乃見福力太子作彼最上極難行事，歡喜歎異。
translation: Again, he observed and saw Prince Fuli doing the most extremely difficult thing, rejoicing and admiring him.

source_sentence: 又念：『今此大威德者，作是難事，何所求邪？
translation: Again, he thought, 'Now that this person of great authority has done such a difficult task, what's wrong with seeking it?'

source_sentence: 我今宜往證驗其故。』
translation: Now, it's appropriate for me to go there and testify to its cause.'

source_sentence: 即變婆羅門相自天而降，住太子前告言：『太子！
translation: He then transformed the Brāhmaṇa's form into that of a god and descended, stood in front of the prince, and told him, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 我向見汝斷自手足，何所為邪？』
translation: I've seen you cut off your own hands and feet; what's wrong with that?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『仁者！
translation: The prince answered, 'Sir, my lord!

source_sentence: 他有苦惱，即我苦惱；
translation: “Others experience suffering and distress. That is to say, they experience the suffering and distress of self.

source_sentence: 若他快樂，即我快樂。
translation: If others are happy, then I am happy.

source_sentence: 故我向者見一被治罰人，甚大苦惱，我時乃以真實力故，棄捨自身手足支分，
translation: That is why I approached him and saw that a man who had been punished was suffering greatly. Then, because of the power of reality, I forgot all my limbs, hands, feet, and other parts.

source_sentence: 填續其人所斷割處，願力真誠，彼獲如故。』
translation: He fills up the place where that person's cut off, vowing with faith and sincerity that they'll attain it as before.'

source_sentence: 「是時帝釋天主，愈生歎異，即復本形，告太子言：『汝今豈非以不實心，
translation: At that moment, the lord of the gods Indra and Śakra Devānām-Indra became increasingly disgusted. He immediately returned to his original form and said to the crown prince, “Your majesty, isn’t it because you

source_sentence: 或異所求，或退轉故，捨自身邪？』
translation: Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is

source_sentence: 太子白言：『天主！
translation: The prince said, 'O lord of gods!

source_sentence: 我所棄捨自身手足，無不實心，亦無異求，又非退轉。』
translation: I abandoned my own hands and feet, didn't have an unreal mind, didn't seek anything different, and didn't turn away.'

source_sentence: 帝釋復言：『汝若然者，云何使我證知是事。』
translation: Śakra again said, 'If that's the case, how can you make me realize this thing?'

source_sentence: 太子白言：『天主！
translation: The prince said, 'O lord of gods!

source_sentence: 汝豈不聞，如我所作，皆真實力。』
translation: Haven't you heard that all of my actions are truly real and powerful?'

source_sentence: 「『若我所言是真實，　　貪愛自身為纏縛；
translation: 'If what I say is true, my craving for self will bind me.

source_sentence: 真實不退轉今時，　　願我此身即如故。』
translation: At the present time, I truly don't regress, so may this body of mine be as it is.'

source_sentence: 太子即於一切有情，隨起慈心，觀察四方以實願力，說伽陀曰：「說是伽陀已，
translation: Then the prince, out of compassion for all sentient beings, observed the four directions with the power of his true vow and said to Gautama, “Having told me this story,

source_sentence: 太子身胑即獲如故。
translation: The prince's body was depressed, and he regained it as before.

source_sentence: 由是空中遍雨天華，奏天微妙可愛音樂，和風徐起，現諸瑞相。
translation: As a result, it rained heavenly flowers all over the sky and played exquisitely beautiful music. A gentle breeze gradually rose and manifested various signs of auspiciousness.

source_sentence: 佛說福力太子因緣經卷第二
translation: Foshuo foulli 太子因緣經卷第二佛說福力太子因緣經經經,卷第二
